title: How to avoid repetition in English - Quora

response.answer_text: The keyword here is SYNONYMS! One word in the English language has so many other words with the same or similar meaning. For example: BIG large, sizeable, of considerable size, substantial, considerable, great, huge, immense, enormous, extensive, colossal, massive, prodigious, tremendous, gigantic, giant, monumental, mighty, stupendous, gargantuan, elephantine, titanic, epic, mountainous, megalithic, monstrous, whopping, mega, humongous, astronomical, ginormous… Although some of these words slightly differ in context, connotation and formality, most of them can be used to replace repetitive words. So instead of saying, “I have a big house beside a big tree in a big city.” You can now use synonyms and say, “I have a large house beside a massive tree in an enormous city.” If you want to find synonyms, you may just google “synonym big” and they will provide you a list. Even better, buy a THESAURUS.
you can google up the synonyms of that particular word and place it accordingly.
